moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. c4: Advised players won't try to defend the pawn.
moves.4... exd5: A new try. Some annoyance can spread now from Qe2+, but nothing unhandable.
moves.5. cxd5 Nxd5 6. Nf3: The isolated d pawn is not easy to handle.
moves.6... Nf4: ?? Qa4+ and I'll lose the N! The idea was to avoid Qe2 after Qd7+, disturbing the developement of white's lsb and considering Nd3+ (BxN it's a clean B pair for black).
moves.7. d4: ? Sparing me from the fatal loss.
moves.7... Bd6 8. Bxf4 Bxf4: Now, of course, Qe2+ becomes possible, and white can develop his lsb.
moves.9. g3 Qe7+ 10. Qe2 Bd6: It's astonishing how bad white's play allows me to play confortably without any of the Qside pieces developed.
moves.11. Qxe7+ Bxe7: Well, white is slighly better now.
moves.12. Nd5: o-o-o was advisable instead, or Bg2.
moves.12... Bd6: It's weird all this B manouvering, but I have another B...
moves.13. Bd3: ? Probably trying to castle Kside, but still Bg2 was needed.
moves.13... Bg4: Bh3 was probably better, threatening Bg2 (by black)
moves.14. Ng5: If your opponent goes after a poisoned pawn... let him and use the tempo.
moves.14... h6: ? Probably Nc6 was much better. The no-queens - no-castling is a less seen asset.
moves.15. Nh7: If g6? Nf6+ of course. But...
moves.16. Ndf6+: A clean piece is mine, but this move has its purpose.
moves.16... gxf6 17. Nxf6+: Where to go? After a double threat, of course.
moves.17... Ke7 18. Be4: This was the point- but not enough to save the game.
moves.19. Nd5+ Kd7 20. Nf6+ Ke6: No queens, no open lines, no white's dsb... I can play moves like this.
moves.22. Kd1 c6: I can let white take b7. I'll lose an exchange, but I will be able to use the tempo.
moves.23. Ne4 Rd8: I'm sorry for my Qside pieces, but this is the forcing move
moves.24. a3 Rxd4+: In a patzer's game like this, I can still fall for tricks. Let's see some of them.
moves.25. Kc2: I can play Rc4+ and after Kb3 I'll lose a piece.
moves.25... Ba5 26. Nc5+: Ouch, by to b7. Still winning.
moves.27. Nxb7 Bb6: Now... where will you go, nighty knight?
moves.28. Re1 Rd7 29. Re8: Interesting, white builds a trick I didn't see. Can you, dear beginner?
moves.33. f3 Bg1 34. h3 Nc6 35. Kd3 Ne5+ 36. K: This was to avoid any escape for the b pawn.
moves.46... a3 47. Kh7: Can I finish him without the Q?
